metadata.title: CVE-2017-16672 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Asterisk Open Source 13 before 13.18.1, 14 before 14.7.1, and 15 before 15.1.1 and Certified Asterisk 13.13 before 13.13-cert7. A memory leak occurs when an Asterisk pjsip session object is created and that call gets rejected before the session itself is fully established. When this happens the session object never gets destroyed. Eventually Asterisk can run out of memory and crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-16672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-config - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-modules - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-tests - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4').
